Body:
Im currently working on the mic array board Respeaker Core V2(debian os and i use Python to code my project), the problem with this board is that it can only play wav audio file, but now i want to streaming audio from an url which protocol send mp3 format data.

This is the code that i used to play mp3 stream with python-vlc(this code work on pc but not on the board):

import vlc	import time		player = vlc.MediaPlayer(url)	playing = set([1,2,3,4])	player.play()		while True:	    state = player.get_state()	    if state not in playing:	        break	    continue

Is there anyway i can convert mp3 to wav while streaming with python or if i can't do that, will i have any other way to stream mp3 url with this board?

Thanks for reading.

[the ReSpeaker Core docs](http://wiki.seeedstudio.com/ReSpeaker_Core/#first-impression-with-voice-interaction-respeaker-play-music) seem to have the answer you're looking for - you can use madplay to play mp3 files.
